intro: Hieracium dollineri subsp. addanum, commonly known as the Addan’s hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and yellow composite flowers, which consist of both ray and disk florets. The plant typically has basal and stem leaves that are lanceolate to ovate in shape, with hairy surfaces. It is native to specific regions in Europe and is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and sometimes endangered species.
